channel.title: Freertos on XploR Eos IDE
channel.description: Recent content in Freertos on XploR Eos IDE

item.title: Getting started
item.description:
To quickly get started with XploR Eos IDE, follow these steps:

  1. Download the latest version of XploR Eos IDE from the official website.
  2. Install XploR Eos IDE on your machine.
  3. Launch XploR Eos IDE and create a new project.
  4. Configure the project settings according to your requirements.
  5. Start coding and exploring the features of XploR Eos IDE.

For more detailed instructions, refer to the official XploR Eos IDE documentation.

Happy coding!

item.title: Creating application with FreeRTOS
item.description:
This project referred to in this chapter is called Blinky. This application prints Blink text. Through the debug session, users can examine RTOS objects such as Task and Queue. The application can also be built and run on QEMU emulator.

To build, run and debug Blinky applications with QEMU emulator, please install the freertos-virt-qemu-blinky-example components first.

Click the Install Dependencies button, select freertos-virt-qemu-blinky-example template and click the Install button.
